availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Lebanon, Kentucky, attorney. Parris, Maine native. Married to Alice A. Noble. Father of Mary C. Noble, William P. Noble, Charles H. Noble, and Daniel A. Noble. Graduated from Harvard University with a Bachelors of Law in 1847. Attorney in Lebanon, Kentucky, in 1860 and 1863. Commonwealth's attorney for the Fifth Judicial District of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1864 to 1867.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon, District 1, p. 43. Lucius M. Boltwood, History and Genealogy of the Family of Thomas Noble, of Westfield, Massachusetts (Hartford, Conn.: Case, Lockwood & Brainard, 1878), p. 153. Kentucky Birth, Marriage, and Death Records, 1852-1910, Ancestry, Deaths, March 1899, p. 43,162; Harvard University Quinquennial Catalogue of the Officers and Graduates 1636-1930 (Cambridge: Harvard University, 1930), p. 1375 (https://iiif.lib.harvard.edu/manifests/view/drs:6796688$1387i) (Accessed on August 17, 2017).
